name: Sewer Plague
transmission: Transmitted through contact with filth or creatures that carry the disease, such as rats and otyughs. Typically contracted through rat bites, wading through sewage, or consuming contaminated food or water.
symptoms: Fatigue, cramps, and increasing exhaustion. The infected creature sweats profusely and has difficulty keeping food down.

effects.description: The infected creature regains only half the normal number of hit points from spending Hit Dice and no hit points from finishing a long rest.

recovery: At the end of each long rest, an infected creature must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature gains one level of exhaustion. On a successful save, the creature's exhaustion level decreases by one level. If a successful saving throw reduces the infected creature's level of exhaustion below 1, the creature recovers from the disease.
cure: A Lesser Restoration spell or similar magic cures the disease immediately.
